name: Renewing Hope Family Counseling Center, Inc.
review_text: This place has been amazing to me. The first therapist I had I liked, but something happened and I was reassigned to a new therapist. My new therapist has been amazing. Sarah S. is always on time and friendly. Always working towards my goals. This place also does telehealth which was very important to me. I don't always have a way to my appointments and to be able to be home and in my own comfortable surroundings is also a major plus.

review_text: This place is an absolute JOKE! I had called for them to send me a link to my email it took them over a week I had to call multiple times and no one ever answers .Finally they send me the link and say call back as soon as I finish to get an appointment schedule .Which I did .for a whole week I called multiple times no one answered I‚Äôve left multiple messages. I called again today 5/21 and the girl says because it took so long for me to call they will not see my  son now!! I told her I‚Äôve been calling and leaving voice messages every day . She says wait a week for someone to call me back with a decision?! What the hell does that even mean a ‚Äúdecision ‚Äú so what my sons referral is no longer valid all because these front desk people can‚Äôt return a phone call or pick up a phone !! How RIDICULOUS ,highly unprofessional ,this place is a a damn joke.Ill be taking my son else where to get help.

name: Renewing Hope Family Counseling Center, Inc.
review_text: Renewing Hope is awful. When you call them they will place you on hold for over 20 minutes. The therapist are incompetent and all they do is repeat what you said to them as if that will help you. They provide nothing to help you cope. Your just lost with no techniques no coping skills and it's a pure waste of time and they seem to be racist all up and through the office. I would never suggest this counseling service PERIOD!!

name: Renewing Hope Family Counseling Center, Inc.
Renewing Hope Family Counseling Center, Inc.
review_text: If your looking for therapy with interns this is the place to go. I had my intake in March with an intern who then was supposed to make an appointment with a therapist. I asked for female, they gave me a male, i cancelled that. 2nd appointment was with an unlicensed intern. I requested,  from Crystal, that they set me up with a licensed therapist. 3rd appointment is with an intern. I ended that session. Called to ask to speak to manager they wont give me a name and cannot guarantee that the insurance will not be billed. All the while I am in true need of help and it's now August! Don't go here. Do not recommend.

name: Renewing Hope Family Counseling Center, Inc.
review_text: Psychiatry and reception have been amazing for the past two years; talk therapists I worked with were a little lacking (one very gently "broke up" with me and recommended me to a colleague because I was primarily going for adhd and related issues plus PTSD, and she said she felt someone else would be better suited to work with me). I still highly recommend this practice. However, they do seem to have a high turnover rate for both med and talk therapy providers, and while I don't know the reason for that, be aware that you might have to switch who you're working with, but you'll likely be passed into good hands.

name: Renewing Hope Family Counseling Center, Inc.
Renewing Hope Family Counseling Center, Inc.
review_text: I admit, getting used to their rules, and their policies took a minute for my brain to compute, but once I understood they have been nothing but great. I will say coming to this facility, Communication is key. Communicating with them about your needs and your lifestyle, so that they can better service you. I have been a little disappointed about their group services, but their 101 services are phenomenal. I think it‚Äôs important to keep in mind that therapy is a journey and you‚Äôre not going to get along with every therapist, so if you‚Äôre not getting along with your therapist, my recommendation would be to let them know immediately so that they can change your therapist. No facility for therapy is perfect and that includes this one. However, I will say that the staff does their absolute best to accommodate you when you needed and to meet you somewhere in the middle so that you can keep your therapy sessions and get your meds. Consistency is definitely key at this facility. The more you commit to your sessions, the more they commit to you.

name: Renewing Hope Family Counseling Center, Inc.
Renewing Hope Family Counseling Center, Inc.
Renewing Hope Family Counseling Center, Inc.
review_text:
I have no respect for a facility who DISCRIMINATED against me and discharged me for requesting to reschedule because I was on my oxygen machine and having a very difficult time breathing let alone the inability to talk for an hour for my therapy appointment. Instead of compassion I was met with the rude attitude as though I was not in medical duress but assumed to be watching Oprah or otherwise.Through my tears and emotional state I realized my (Therapist) Deserae Leanna Quezada
Licensed Clinical Social Worker, Lic # 95180 had no concern about my medical health at that moment and was more worried about her calendar. Of course I requested to be reassigned to a new therapist and the representative who assisted me recommended Mary Stevens due to her character and integrity of understanding as she witnessed first hand as a colleague of Mary‚Äôs. In addition this representative shared that her relative has Lupus like myself but I have Chronic Respiratory Failure as well. She thought I would be a great fit as a patient with Mary so I booked an appointment. A few hours later I get a call from Leticia claiming to be the Clinical Director who informed me that per Deserae Leanna Quezada
Licensed Clinical Social Worker, Lic # 95180‚Ä¶I WAS BEING DISCHARGED FOR THERAPEUTIC SERVICES because I couldn‚Äôt participate in the video appointment today and in violation of attendance policy. If this isn‚Äôt the MOST DISCRIMINATORY action by a medical provider in my opinion then I don‚Äôt know what is!!! I was told that I was to give 48 hour notice to cancel and my past missed sessions where we couldn‚Äôt see or hear one another that had nothing to do with me, I was giving NO WARNING ABOUT BEING AT RISK OF DISCHARGE and please note that the claimed Clinical Director stated on the phone call that THEY OFFER NO ACCOMMODATIONS TO THEIR PATIENTS IN ACCORDANCE TO THE ATTENDANCE POLICY and I assume the rest as well. My missed appointments were all medical related, the others were cancelled due to their own system portal issues on several occasions. I‚Äôm chronically ill with Systemic Lupus and Chronic Respiratory Failure that comes with FLARE UPS at any given moment. So when it came close to my appointment today I‚Äôm grasping to breath while on oxygen and realize that I will NOT BE ABLE TO TALK A FULL HOUR to be further at risk so I calked and had my daughter to take over because I couldn't breath and talk sufficiently. When my daughter asked how does a patient who is chronically ill have a sudden flare up the day and/or time of set appointment give a cancellation or 48hr notice? Of course she couldn‚Äôt answer that question and NOR COULD THE CLAIMED CLINICAL DIRECTOR, LETICIA. Remember I was assigned a new therapist and then a few hours later discharged FROM THERAPY ONLY but I could REMAIN WITH MY PSYCHIATRIC SERVICES. Hmm‚Ä¶If I in fact violated the attendance policy then why do you want to keep me as a patient for any services? AGAIN, why didn‚Äôt you notify me of potentially being discharged before the SUDDEN discharge date? That didn‚Äôt happen by chance it was MANIPULATIVE and DELIBERATE to CTOA (Cover There Own A*^). Deserae, LCSW was put in check by my daughter in my defense for being bullied by her and could NOT HANDLE THE HEAT nor ANSWER THE MOST IMPORTANT QUESTION:
How does a patient who is chronically ill have a sudden flare up the day and/or time of set appointment give a cancellation or 48hour notice???
I don‚Äôt want another patient especially if they are chronically ill with flare ups to go through the emotional duress which further impacted my mental health that caused me to have a major anxiety attack that further exacerbated my respiratory breathing problems. I did my due diligence by filing a IEHP grievance against them and I will file against them with Medi-Cal , Medicare, ADA and pursue legal action like I did so with the Housing Authority for not abiding by ADA accommodations! GAME ON B****z!!!

name: Renewing Hope Family Counseling Center, Inc.
review_text:
This is the worst place to try and receive services from their leadership is weak and will not take accountability for the decisions or mistakes that their staff makes. I almost lost my child due to doctors uninformed, uneducated decision. Do not trust for a second that they will help you in any formality!!!!!
When your child is in a crisis they will drop you as a client instead assuring that a safety plan is in place or that your child is transferred to more skilled, experienced, knowledgeable agency.
They followed up on my calls after twos weeks and only when I told them my lawyer would be calling them to follow up if they choose to keep ignoring me !!!!
Then I got a call from the president that could care less that I almost lost my child due to the doctors under her responsibility.
BEWARE of places like this, I worked with our former agency for the last two years and was NEVER dropped because we were experience a crisis.
Renewing Hope doesn‚Äôt even stick to what their name represents.
Thank you for showing me as a parent you will offer no support or responsibilities for the decisions you and your staff make !!!!
The president said it‚Äôs because my insurance her only response so ignorant .I had the same insurance with previous agency.
Become clear on what your intention is in providing services, MY child was not just another number !!!!!
-sincerely,
You know who!!!
I am a MAMA

name: Renewing Hope Family Counseling Center, Inc.
Renewing Hope Family Counseling Center, Inc.
Renewing Hope Family Counseling Center, Inc.
review_text: I am so grateful for the staff at Renewing Hope Family Counseling Center. They are kind and caring individual's who really care about my family and I. I feel safe being in their office with their strict COVID protocols and appreciate their concern over the safety of the staff and their clients. The receptionists are warm and friendly, making me feel safe and comfortable. The environment is inviting and overall welcoming. The therapists I have worked with are knowledgeable and well experienced and have helped me tremendously.
